back.text:
Root: — (particle)
Meaning: When
Pronunciation: Idhā
Tajweed Rules: Madd Ṭabīʿī on the long alif of ذَا (2 counts).
Derived Words: As a particle it has no derived forms.
Example Ayah: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ لَا تُفْسِدُوا

hint.text: The opening word of the Sūrah, introducing a future event.

back.text:
Root: ج ي أ (J-Y-ʾ)
Meaning: Came / There comes
Pronunciation: Jāʾa
Tajweed Rules: Madd Wājib Muttaṣil on the long alif (4–5 counts).
Derived Words:
1. مَجِيء (Majīʾ): Coming
2. جَائِي (Jāʾī): One who comes
Example Ayah: وَجَاءَتْ سَيَّارَةٌ

hint.text: Refers to the arrival of Allah’s help.

back.text:
Root: ن ص ر (N-Ṣ-R)
Meaning: Help, victory
Pronunciation: Naṣru
Tajweed Rules: Istiʿlā (heavy sound) on Ṣād.
Derived Words:
1. نَصَرَ (Naṣara): He helped
2. مَنْصُور (Manṣūr): Victorious
3. نَصِير (Naṣīr): A helper
4. اِنْتِصَار (Intiṣār): Victory
Example Ayah: وَمَا لَكُم مِّن دُونِ اللَّهِ مِن وَلِيٍّ وَلَا نَصِيرٍ

hint.text: Refers to the help and victory of Allah.

back.text:
Root: ف ت ح (F-T-Ḥ)
Meaning: The victory, opening
Pronunciation: Al-Fatḥu
Tajweed Rules: Alif-Lām Qamariyyah (clear lām).
Derived Words:
1. فَتَحَ (Fataḥa): He opened
2. مِفْتَاح (Miftāḥ): Key
3. فَتَّاح (Fattāḥ): The Opener
4. فُتُوح (Futūḥ): Openings
Example Ayah: فَافْتَحْ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَهُمْ فَتْحًا

hint.text: Alludes to the conquest of Makkah.

back.text:
Root: د خ ل (D-Kh-L)
Meaning: Entering
Pronunciation: Yadkhulūna
Tajweed Rules: Qalqalah on د; Madd Ṭabīʿī on لُو.
Derived Words:
1. دُخُول (Dukhūl): Entry
2. مَدْخَل (Madkhal): Entrance
3. أَدْخَلَ (Adkhala): He caused to enter
4. دَاخِل (Dākhil): Internal
Example Ayah: فَادْخُلُوا أَبْوَابَ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا

Root: د ي ن (D-Y-N)
Meaning: Religion, way of life
Pronunciation: Dīni
Tajweed Rules: Madd Ṭabīʿī on دِي.
Derived Words:
1. دَيْن (Dayn): Debt
2. دَانَ (Dāna): He obeyed
3. دَيْنُونَة (Daynūnah): Judgment, indebtedness
Example Ayah: لَكُمْ دِينُكُمْ وَلِيَ دِينِ

hint.text: The path or system of belief.

back.text:
Root: ف و ج (F-W-J)
Meaning: In crowds, groups
Pronunciation: Afwājan
Tajweed Rules: Madd Ṭabīʿī on وَا; tanwīn followed by hamzah is pronounced with ikhfāʾ.
Derived Words:
1. فَوْج (Fawj): A group
2. اِسْتَفْوَجَ (Istafwaja): To form a group
Example Ayah: Unique to this Sūrah in the Qurʾān.

hint.text: People entering Islam in large groups.

back.text:
Root: س ب ح (S-B-Ḥ)
Meaning: So glorify
Pronunciation: Fasabbiḥ
Tajweed Rules: Shaddah on بّ and clear ḥāʾ.
Derived Words:
1. سُبْحَان (Subḥān): Glory
2. تَسْبِيح (Tasbīḥ): Glorification
3. سَبَحَ (Sabaḥa): He swam/floated
Example Ayah: وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ قَبْلَ طُلُوعِ الشَّمْسِ

Root: ح م د (Ḥ-M-D)
Meaning: With the praise
Pronunciation: Biḥamdi
Tajweed Rules: Standard pronunciation.
Derived Words:
1. حَمْد (Ḥamd): Praise
2. أَحْمَد (Aḥmad): More praiseworthy
3. مَحْمُود (Maḥmūd): Praiseworthy
4. حَمِيد (Ḥamīd): Praiseworthy
Example Ayah: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

Root: ت و ب (T-W-B)
Meaning: Ever-Accepting of repentance
Pronunciation: Tawwāban
Tajweed Rules: Shaddah on وّ; Madd Ṭabīʿī on بَا.
Derived Words:
1. تَوْبَة (Tawbah): Repentance
2. تَابَ (Tāba): He repented
3. مُتَاب (Mutāb): One who repents
Example Ayah: إِنَّهُ هُوَ التَّوَّابُ الرَّحِيمُ
